intro: Koanophyllon palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's leafless bursage, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, leafless stems that are covered in dense, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and crevices. Koanophyllon palmeri is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy species of the desert ecosystem.
